event: Apollo 11 astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin became the first humans to land on the Moon.
The Japanese attacked Pearl Harbor, leading the United States to enter World War II.
The Berlin Wall fell, marking a symbolic end to the Cold War.
Japan formally surrendered aboard the USS Missouri, officially ending World War II.
The United States Declaration of Independence was adopted in Philadelphia.
The U.S. stock market crashed on Black Tuesday, leading to the Great Depression.
An atomic bomb was dropped on Hiroshima by the United States during World War II.
Victory in Europe Day was celebrated as Nazi Germany's surrender became official.
D-Day occurred as Allied forces landed on the beaches of Normandy, France.
The RMS Titanic sank in the North Atlantic after hitting an iceberg.
Terrorist attacks were carried out on the World Trade Center and the Pentagon in the United States.
U.S. President John F. Kennedy was assassinated in Dallas, Texas.
Rosa Parks refused to give up her seat on a bus in Montgomery, Alabama, sparking the Civil Rights Movement.
Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria was assassinated, leading to the outbreak of World War I.
The 19th Amendment was ratified, granting American women the right to vote.
Yuri Gagarin became the first human to journey into outer space.
The Chernobyl nuclear disaster occurred in the Soviet Union.
The Tiananmen Square protests were suppressed by the Chinese government.
Nelson Mandela was released from prison after 27 years in South Africa.
The Woodstock Music Festival began in Bethel, New York.
Barack Obama was elected as the first African-American President of the United States.
The wreck of the RMS Titanic was discovered on the ocean floor.
Christopher Columbus landed in the Americas, marking the beginning of European exploration.
An armistice was signed, effectively ending World War I.
The Cuban Missile Crisis ended as Soviet missiles were removed from Cuba.
Martin Luther King Jr. delivered his "I Have a Dream" speech in Washington, D.C.
MTV launched, marking a new era in music and television.
Sir Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay reached the summit of Mount Everest.
The Soviet Union was officially dissolved.
A massive tsunami struck Southeast Asia following a 9.1 magnitude earthquake.
Hurricane Katrina made landfall on the Gulf Coast of the United States.
Osama bin Laden was killed by U.S. forces in Pakistan.
The 2012 Summer Olympics opened in London.
A devastating earthquake struck Haiti, causing widespread destruction.
Hong Kong was handed over from the United Kingdom to China.
The Stonewall riots began in New York City, sparking the modern LGBTQ+ rights movement.
Saigon fell, marking the end of the Vietnam War.
The United States celebrated its Bicentennial.
The Civil Rights Act was signed into law in the United States.
The world celebrated the beginning of the new millennium.
Tim Berners-Lee proposed the World Wide Web.
India gained independence from British rule.
The Paris Peace Accords were signed, intended to establish peace in Vietnam.
Sputnik 1, the first artificial satellite, was launched by the Soviet Union.
John Glenn became the first American to orbit the Earth.
Space Shuttle Columbia disintegrated upon re-entry, killing all seven astronauts.
Martin Luther King Jr. was assassinated in Memphis, Tennessee.
Apple CEO Steve Jobs unveiled the first iPhone.
The Paris Agreement on climate change was adopted by nearly every nation.
The World Health Organization declared COVID-19 a global pandemic.
